activities: Pebble offers electronic smartwatch devices to consumers.  Pebble collects data during certain transactions and communications with its customers, including when they purchase Pebble products and services, register for and use Pebble products and services, participate in surveys or contests, use Pebble’s website, and contact Pebble for customer support.  Pebble may also collect device and usage information in connection with a customer’s use of Pebble devices as described in our posted Privacy Policy.   Customer data may be transferred from EU customers to Pebble (which is located in the United States) for the purposes of providing the services, marketing, supporting transactions, security, customer and technical support, customer communications, improving products and services, auditing, data analysis, and data storage.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: On-line, off-line, and manually processed customer data
recoursemech: Consumers should contact the BBB's EU Safe Harbor Dispute Resolution Program (http://www.bbb.org/us/european-dispute-resolution/consumer/) with privacy complaints or concerns.
